description: Creates a Recycle Bin retention rule. You can create two types of retention rules: For more information, see Create Recycle Bin retention rules in the Amazon EBS User Guide.

parameters.name: RetentionPeriod
parameters.description: Information about the retention period for which the retention rule is to retain resources. The period value for which the retention rule is to retain resources. The period is measured using the unit specified for RetentionPeriodUnit. The unit of time in which the retention period is measured. Currently, only DAYS is supported.

nested_params.name: RetentionPeriodUnit
nested_params.description: The unit of time in which the retention period is measured. Currently, only DAYS is supported.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: Information about the tags to assign to the retention rule. (dict) --- Information about the tags to assign to the retention rule. The tag key. The tag value.

parameters.name: ResourceType
parameters.description: The resource type to be retained by the retention rule. Currently, only Amazon EBS snapshots and EBS-backed AMIs are supported. To retain snapshots, specify EBS_SNAPSHOT. To retain EBS-backed AMIs, specify EC2_IMAGE.

parameters.name: ResourceTags
parameters.description: [Tag-level retention rules only] Specifies the resource tags to use to identify resources that are to be retained by a tag-level retention rule. For tag-level retention rules, only deleted resources, of the specified resource type, that have one or more of the specified tag key and value pairs are retained. If a resource is deleted, but it does not have any of the specified tag key and value pairs, it is immediately deleted without being retained by the retention rule. You can add the same tag key and value pair to a maximum or five retention rules. To create a Region-level retention rule, omit this parameter. A Region-level retention rule does not have any resource tags specified. It retains all deleted resources of the specified resource type in the Region in which the rule is created, even if the resources are not tagged. (dict) --- [Tag-level retention rules only] Information about the resource tags used to identify resources that are retained by the retention rule. The tag key. ResourceTagValue (string) --- The tag value.

parameters.name: LockConfiguration
parameters.description: Information about the retention rule lock configuration. Information about the retention rule unlock delay. The unlock delay period, measured in the unit specified for UnlockDelayUnit. The unit of time in which to measure the unlock delay. Currently, the unlock delay can be measure only in days.

nested_params.name: UnlockDelay
nested_params.description: Information about the retention rule unlock delay.

nested_params.name: UnlockDelayUnit
nested_params.description: The unit of time in which to measure the unlock delay. Currently, the unlock delay can be measure only in days.

parameters.name: ExcludeResourceTags
parameters.description: [Region-level retention rules only] Specifies the exclusion tags to use to identify resources that are to be excluded, or ignored, by a Region-level retention rule. Resources that have any of these tags are not retained by the retention rule upon deletion. You can't specify exclusion tags for tag-level retention rules. (dict) --- [Tag-level retention rules only] Information about the resource tags used to identify resources that are retained by the retention rule. The tag key. ResourceTagValue (string) --- The tag value.

nested_items.name: Identifier
nested_items.description: The unique ID of the retention rule.

nested_items.name: RetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: Information about the retention period for which the retention rule is to retain resources.

nested_items.name: RetentionPeriodValue
nested_items.description: The period value for which the retention rule is to retain resources. The period is measured using the unit specified for RetentionPeriodUnit.

nested_items.name: RetentionPeriodUnit
nested_items.description: The unit of time in which the retention period is measured. Currently, only DAYS is supported.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The retention rule description.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Information about the tags assigned to the retention rule.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The tag key.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The tag value.

nested_items.name: ResourceType
nested_items.description: The resource type retained by the retention rule.

nested_items.name: ResourceTags
nested_items.description: [Tag-level retention rules only] Information about the resource tags used to identify resources that are retained by the retention rule.

nested_items.name: ResourceTagKey
nested_items.description: The tag key.

nested_items.name: ResourceTagValue
nested_items.description: The tag value.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The state of the retention rule. Only retention rules that are in the available state retain resources.

nested_items.name: LockConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about the retention rule lock configuration.

nested_items.name: UnlockDelay
nested_items.description: Information about the retention rule unlock delay.

nested_items.name: UnlockDelayValue
nested_items.description: The unlock delay period, measured in the unit specified for UnlockDelayUnit.

nested_items.name: UnlockDelayUnit
nested_items.description: The unit of time in which to measure the unlock delay. Currently, the unlock delay can be measure only in days.

nested_items.name: LockState
nested_items.description: [Region-level retention rules only] The lock state for the retention rule.
locked - The retention rule is locked and can't be modified or deleted.
pending_unlock - The retention rule has been unlocked but it is still within the unlock delay period. The retention rule can be modified or deleted only after the unlock delay period has expired.
unlocked - The retention rule is unlocked and it can be modified or deleted by any user with the required permissions.
null - The retention rule has never been locked. Once a retention rule has been locked, it can transition between the locked and unlocked states only; it can never transition back to null.

nested_items.name: RuleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the retention rule.

nested_items.name: ExcludeResourceTags
nested_items.description: [Region-level retention rules only] Information about the exclusion tags used to identify resources that are to be excluded, or ignored, by the retention rule.

nested_items.name: ResourceTagKey
nested_items.description: The tag key.

nested_items.name: ResourceTagValue
nested_items.description: The tag value.
